intro: Galium krymense, commonly known as Crimean bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Crimean Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium krymense typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
